text: Once your database instance is up and running, you can connect to it using SSH.
We will connect to the instance from our web browser using the MindTerm SSH Client.
You will need to have Java installed and enabled for your browser.
You will also need to know the location of the private key file from when you created your key pair.
Right click on your instance, and select Connect.
Click Connect from your browser using the Java SSH Client.
AWS automatically detects the public DNS address and the key pair name for your instance.
Enter root into the user name text box.
The key name is automatically populated for you.
In Path to private key, enter the fully qualified path to your .pem private key file.
If you would like your browser to remember the location of your private key file for later use,
check the box for Stored in browser cache under Save Key Location.
The MindTerm SSH client window will appear.
When prompted to add this host to your set of known hosts, click Yes.
You are now connected to your EC2 instance.
